title: america has a problem
excerpt:
Gather up your friends and loved ones because America has a problem. Join us on July 5th for an anti-July 4th show that challenges the status quo and celebrates resistance through music and community. Enjoy five talented musicians as they shake up your post-July 4th weekend with a night of electrifying performances and unapologetic artistry.

This event is by suggested donation, and there will be food and drinks available for purchase, and clothing by .ɯoʇuɐɥP

Doors open at 8:00pm with the show starting right away so don't be late! Here's the powerful lineup for the night:

title: Imperial Motors Annexes Wonderville
excerpt:
Imperial Motors is a frenetic hydra, fusing baritone a la a Xiu-Xiu Morrissey, bugged-out screams of dystopian anxiety, and surprising moments of serenity - supported by furious wonky bass, I-Have-No-Mouth-And-I-Must-Scream techno-guitar, synths playful and dissonant, all underpinned by homicidal, infectious drum grooves. Comprised of Liam O'Toole (vocals, fretless & fretted basses), Ben Biber (keyboard, synthesizer, rhythm guitar, vocals), Andrew Garces (lead guitar, engineering), and Josh Cukier (vocals, drums, percussion).

With roots in Syracuse, New York, The Whether Channel is an emo band that meets zero expectations but hey, you’re reading this. Starting as a joke with the intent to break up after one show, an overwhelming positive response from the Syracuse basement scene convinced founding members Andrew Garces (guitar/vocals) and Rory Stanley (guitar/vocals) to formalize the group. Self-described as “bummer core," their innovative combination of metalcore, emo pop, and math rock manifests as passionate and hard hitting songs to scream along to. Garces and Stanley are joined by the excellent rhythm section of JJ Alleyne (drums) and Nikki Tardiff (bass).

[INSTAGRAM]

Imperial Motors: @impmo

Whether Channel: @thewhetherchannelband

[MUSIC]

Imperial Motors

Whether Channel rsvp

title: The Nookie: The Ultimate Nu Metal Party
excerpt:
Welcome to The Nookie: The Ultimate Nu Metal Party!

A FREE DJ based dance party blasting all of your favorite "nu metal" anthems.

Join us as djyngjoe and bradcantsleep spin the greatest hits from genre legends like Slipknot, Limp Bizkit, System of a Down, Korn, Incubus, Disturbed, and many more.

Dive face first into a night of head banging, moshing, and singing at the top of your lungs to your favorite nu metal bangers at Wonderville on July 11th! #numetal #thenookie #korn #slipknot #disturbed #limpbizkit #creed #woodstock99 #soad rsvp

title: Tha Bois In Wonder(ville)
excerpt:
Tha Bois are the Unkahmen trio that defies musical genres, blending nostalgic remixes with classic house, techno, and more in a spontaneous collaboration with each DJ contributing a distinct flavor to the decks. They thrive on uncertainty, allowing the crowd's vibe to shape the sound of the party.

https://www.instagram.com/tha___bois/

https://www.instagram.com/unkahmen/

https://soundcloud.com/tha_bois RSVP

title: 2 Hr GameJam Club (Scratch)
excerpt: Make a game in 2 hours!Each month, we will make short games using simple to use game engines.This is great for beginners who want to make AND FINISH their first game!This is also great for experts who want to flex their skills and meet new people.1:00 PM Doors1:30 PM Workshop2:00 PM Game Jam Starts!4:00 PM Jam Ends, Presentations Start!5:00 PM The arcade opens for regular use.This event will be streamed online, so people across the world can participate.This event is free to attend but donations are welcome and help pay for your instructor! RSVP

title: Wonderville Karaoke
excerpt: You got the music in you? Come down to Wonderville, on the second Sunday of every month, to share a song with the gentle hum of DIY arcade games as your backup singers. Or simply be entertained by the vocal stylings of randos off the street. Either way, don't forget to tip your bartender! rsvp

title: Robot Karaoke Cage-Match
excerpt:
ROBOT KARAOKE CAGE MATCH is karaoke on impossible mode. Performers try to sing songs they know, but with all-new words generated by A.I. The songs are rewritten live, so each one has never been heard before and will never be heard again.

We take live audience requests for both the SONG and the DATASET the computer uses to rewrite the lyrics. You can request songs ahead of time here.

Some examples we've sung at past shows:

- CRAIGSLIST VEHICLE ADS to the tune of COUNTRY ROADS

- NEGATIVE REVIEWS OF PROFESSORS to the tune of VAMPIRE

- BERNIE SANDERS EMAIL SUBJECT LINES to the tune of DON'T STOP BELIEVIN'

Video of the last show

Hosted by Jamie Brew and Jenn Schiffer, two tech entrepreneurs on a mission make karaoke harder and worse.

Free admission

Suggested donation - $10

The event will be livestreamed on Wonderville's Twitch Channel rsvp

title: WordHack
excerpt:
WordHack is a monthly evening of performances and talks exploring the intersection of language and technology. Code poetry, digital literature, e-lit, language games, coders interested in the creative side, writers interested in new forms writing can take, all are welcome here.

Lineup to be announced!

We also have our OPEN PROJECTOR (like an open mic for digital work) where anyone can sign up to share a piece for 5 minutes at the start of the show. The open projector signup sheet will go out at 6:45 the day of the show.Host & Curator: TODD ANDERSONTickets - $15The event will be livestreamed at https://twitch.tv/wondervillenycJoin the WordHack Email ListGet a digital copy of the WordHack Anthology

title: Adult Fantasy Novel, Sable, Kablamo
excerpt:
Sable is Nate Garner, Jaco Imani, and Dmitri Burtis. They've been making some experimental mixture of math rock, jazz, and electronic music for this last little slice of the pie. Their music has been described by various community icons as "the best" and "sick". They have also received flavorful comments like "wow listen to this jizz jazz". They are not a group to be missed

https://sablemusic.bandcamp.com/album/ayllu-part-2

Adult Fantasy Novel is a New York based post-digital alternative rock band featuring Tyler Postiglione on guitar, Santiago Hervella on bass, Ellen Hardcastle on synths and keys, and Patrick Hagan on drums. The group is inspired by science fiction and often incorporates the theme in their music, lyrics, and promotional materials. Their debut EP titled Elevator, described as “full of magic” (Phonograph Me), was independently released in October 2022. Adult Fantasy Novel has made appearances in several New York venues, including Mercury Lounge, Heaven Can Wait, and Gold Sounds. Current influences include David Byrne circa 1984 and Neil Young circa 1972

https://listen.tidal.com/album/249824821/track/249824823

Kablamo is an alt-rock duo currently based in Brooklyn, NY. The band is fronted by Julia Bellontine and Santiago Coto, and are supported live by Aidan Ludlam (rhythm guitar, vocals) and Charlie Peterson (bass). Known for their ethereal and gritty guitar tones, their shows produce a rich sonic atmosphere. They’re drawn to melodic and riff centered music and reap much of their artistic inspiration from DIIV, Crumb, and the modern-day shoegaze scene.

https://www.instagram.com/kablamo.ny rsvp

title: PERSERVERANCE, a release show
excerpt:
JUNECINEMA, the hip-hop duo consisting of Yonkers MC Jay Cinema & Charlotte's JUNE!, are coming forward with their standalone debut "PERSERVERANCE". A project meant to be appreciated. Join us for a live run with special guests in tow!

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/junecinemanyc

Music: https://open.spotify.com/track/1aaDpX3KZzH699X9ONkNmw?si=wUG9e8UETMu5g7L3112qkw

video: https://youtu.be/vxKs4XcuaCc?si=TGXBwfknY8wqTJ9-

The Brooklyn MC Desde can hold her own plenty outside duo MORIVIVI as her work standalone holds weight in the scene. Her recent EP "Tongue Original" is a definite go to if you need that work.

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/tng_og

Music: https://open.spotify.com/album/3NHCjz2uTCHcCsCEvzrWTy?si=V-_pOBdVTdiHfubLb4fHMQ

video: https://youtu.be/QcVlufcVCBE?si=SIMhFoHKFE6tzZco

Shemar's musical ability knows no bounds, already having a weighted project in Child Actor-collaboration "sunscreen". The New York rapper-producer's uncanny style may leave you for a long lasting loop as his flows cascade with each instrumental.

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/shemar.alexander

Music: https://open.spotify.com/album/34mlrYjiczEnQ1L4sUQEYh?si=b6ujMxs8SBGAuLvqA6a_QQ

video: https://youtu.be/MTj1sUNblfA?si=sRXkMJ48KrmsTu6x

Johnny Storm is HIM. The Long Island native shows real finesse within his versatility. His collaboration effort "Cold Fish 3" with Fony Wallace had this best on display, 10/10.

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/johnnystorm_

Music: https://open.spotify.com/album/2e7rjogR8tB4s6fLuoCL2y?si=-nioXKscT4aFUcv6ZgGb5Q

video: https://youtu.be/rnteDeJ29vM?si=Nw3x10UiWBLzHTxq

South Jersey's Wiseboy Jeremy came a long way from his beginning. With his upcoming effort with long time collaborator Kirti Pandey on the way, the MC has been going strong, displaying what's yet to come with recent singles.

Instagram:

https://www.instagram.com/wiseboyjeremy?igsh=ZDN1bG1lczI4dmE0

music: https://open.spotify.com/track/7vEcSZm3quV5QLfZ18ZNl6?si=07mUljyNTLO0H_i549Lk9w&context=spotify:album:2pnMGn95oaZyR7b5SNYDLm

video: https://youtu.be/MQiwIQCxZ9E?si=DVGS2O-x890E2R1V

sounds by Matt Swain rsvp

title: Zack./Starcard/Castrated Caligula
excerpt:
Heavy pop for Monday night. Get in and hear the best tunes you'll ever hear wassup wassup.

Zack.

Zack. is the longtime name for musician Zack Schiavetta. Since 2014, from the Demo Tapes EP to 2018's Archimedian Point and their singles, has hovered over the NYC DIY music scene with their pop guitar catchyness and egghead mannerisms. A new EP is forthcoming.

Zacksmusicbox.bandcamp.com

https://www.instagram.com/zacksmusicbox?igsh=MXRnM3pncjliaGpocA==

Starcard

Their FreakWorld EP, released April last year, evokes Jandek and early 21st century avant garde tape distortion (like something William Basinski would perform). All while retaining pop sensibilities. FreakWorld is a jarring but welcoming listen to anyone who wishes to sit in its charm.

Starcard.bandcamp.com

https://www.instagram.com/_starcard?igsh=Z3EzaWNrOHFpMjVh

Castrated Caligula

Will Table's heavy Castrated Caligula. Will is more or less a legend in the DIY scene not only in the city but throughout the tri state area. His records with the band Old Table and Climax Landers lend a kitchsy pop quality to them. But for this night, it is his heaviest project, Castrated Caligula that takes the stage. Eat it, Zorn.

https://www.instagram.com/castratedcaligula?igsh=YWJqMXQ5aDgyc3Uy

https://www.instagram.com/oldtablemusic?igsh=MWNyZzByb3lpcjJveg== RSVP

title: Open VCR Night
excerpt: THE RULES:1. BYO VHS, or use one of ours2. Anyone may eject at any time3. If you eject, you must INSERT TAPETHE ANTICIPATED:90s Disney, workout videos, softcore, student films, local interest, choir recitals, insensitive cringe: anything may play. Anything may be ejected.Live commentary in the Twitch stream by FORT90.Live commentary in the room by you.ADDENDA:1. Fast-forwarding & rewinding is cautiously permitted, as is booing.2. Livestreamed to twitch.tv/wondervillenyc. Twitch chat is powerless.4. Ends 10:00PM. Watch on Twitch

title: A Night of Queer Pop Electronica
excerpt:
Local NYC queer and trans artists Toska, Reya Flowers, Effee Hawk, and The Canvas Collective present a night of pop and electronica. Just in time for pride!

Effee Hawk, the host, is an experimental dance artist. Their sound ranges from dark ambient, to bops that’ll make you sway. Songs are programmed within their small yet powerful keyboard, which they have mastered over the years. Their music is hypnotizing, lyrics are out right confessions, and it will pull you right in. Their performance will be accompanied by live visuals done by July Brown (Crush Fund).

Effee on Spotify: https://open.spotify.com/artist/3E42UnW2sEB7heWcsf5Yfd?si=otLsu8W7Tkq4MDgPJOHtHA

Effee on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/effeehawk

Self described as “danceable, devastating”, Toska is a pop-rock-electro duo with guitar, and with vocals that are transcendent. Their stage looks could kill. Confessional lyrics, flowy melodies, and epic sounds. (The lead singer also does tattoos on the side!)

Toska on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/666toska

Toska on Spotify: https://open.spotify.com/artist/3s1p9e82dJbWxoCo4LtPp7

Reya Flowers is an electric alternative music artist. Her sound ranges from rock, to emo, to pop, revealing her to be an artist of great talent and range. Her vocals? Ethereal, and her sound layering? Impeccable.

Reya on Spotify: https://open.spotify.com/artist/6sH30VAK5dvqoxS6KqQ1ab

Reya on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/reya.flowers

The Canvas Collective is an alt pop-rock band based out of Brooklyn, New York. They are proud to write and release songs that are very personal to them, with lyrical topics such as mental health awareness, interpersonal struggles, and queer/trans identity. They are currently playing shows in Brooklyn and working on an album that is heavily influenced by electronic music, combining that sound with guitar, bass and singing/screaming. Mandy Kessler on vocals/synth, Kris Wong on guitar, and Violet Sepe on bass.

Canvas on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/thecanvascollectiveofficial

Canvas on Spotify: https://open.spotify.com/artist/6s7d9ilo1bVKs58ONW1NsB

All artists can also be found on Bandcamp, and wherever you find music. BUY TICKETS

title: Comix Library - Rock & Roll Edition
excerpt:
The Comix Library has comic books and graphic novels from @bazankali to satiate all of your boogie fantasies, disco dreams, and punk hankerins.

Drink, eat, read, play games. All books are free to read, just return them by 6pm. rsvp

title: Spookystack X Pisha Joint Single Release Show
excerpt:
Experience the enchanting fusion of electronic synth-wave melodies as Brooklyn-based bands Spookystack and Pisha join forces for a mystical late-night extravaganza at Wonderville!

Spookystack weaves a sophisticated tapestry of cold-wave, post-punk, and pulsating EBM influences into their performances. With a determined grasp on electronic synthesis, Spookystack pushes the boundaries set by their predecessors. Join Spookystack in celebrating the release of their new single, "Western Paradise," from their upcoming debut album, "Operator."

Spookystack: @spookystack | https://spookystack.bandcamp.com/music

Pisha is the project of Brooklyn, NY based songwriter and producer, Madeline Kassen. Creating avant-garde electro-pop with a gothic rock edge, Pisha toes the line of experimental music with power pop melodies soaring over hypnagogic soundscapes. Come join Pisha for the unveiling of their latest single, "WTF."

Pisha: @pishapost | https://www.pishapisha.com/listen

Joining Spookystack and Pisha for their single release celebration is none other than Brooklyn-based punk trio, Le Bang. With a playful and mischievous spirit, Le Bang embodies the very essence of punk rock. Praised by The Deli Magazine for crafting "pop-y punk songs that will be stuck in your head for weeks," Le Bang has a knack for getting even the angriest punks to groove.

Le Bang: @itslebang | https://lebangmusic.com/music

The event will be supported by sets from Dj Selfie and Dj Ruby Bell.

DJ Selfie: @sself_ie | https://soundcloud.com/909worldwide/red-rubber-ball?ref=clipboard&p=i&c=0&utm_source=clipboard&utm_medium=text&utm_campaign=social_sharing

DJ Ruby Bell: @ruby3bell buy tickets

title: Embryo Concepts Zine Issue 8 Release Party
excerpt:
Embryo Concepts is a literary zine started in 2019 by local creatives interested in promoting work of writers and artists from all over. You can read past issues at www.embryoconceptszine.com.

We are excited to celebrate the release of its eight issue at Wonderville!

Come by and pick up print issues of current and past issues, as well as check out readings and performances by ambient bass guitarist Sadie Powers and experimental pop duo Receiver. And there will be cake! rsvp

title: Tackycardia
excerpt:
Tackycardia returns to Wonderville for our Pride Month edition featuring more of your favorite 150+ bpm beats.

Joining us for our 14th show will be our newest resident DJ/team member Cryostatik as well as fellow residents Alex Viper (l3ftfield and Bean (ayobean).

For our guests, we’ll be joined by David L:unch, who holds a residency on Newtown Radio called Zero Chill, as well asDJ Allegation who curates the event series connexions.nyc. We’ll also feature Preethi who curates the DNB event series Jungle Cats as well as Philly based Jungle stalwart Static Quo who’ll be coming to town to pay us a visit. Visuals by Freak.

Expect the usual fast beats, good vibes, free entry and free to play arcade games from 8pm-3am :) See you all in the dance Rsvp

title: Disasterpiece Movie Night: A Talking Cat?!?
excerpt:
Disasterpiece is celebrating its third birthday with a BIG party to watch the WORST talking cat movie ever made, "A Talking Cat?!?" Free pizza, prizes, games, and the exclusive drop of the Disasterpiece Podcast, coming soon!

From the wondrous to the weird, Disasterpiece unearths bad movies for a watch party complete with drinking games, trivia, pizza, and a couple surprises. rsvp

title: Saison Zero
excerpt:
Your friendly neighborhood TTRPG Meetup is Back! Saison Zero is a monthly tabletop role play game meetup dedicated to introducing folks to games other than just D&D. Light on rules, rich in flavor. This month we’ve got….. A SURPRISE!! Come on down and see what we’re playing!

NO EXPERIENCE NECESSARY. This is a beginner friendly event. Rulebooks and other resources will be available. We encourage you to bring dice if you have them and something to write with, but we’ll have extras!

Questions? Reach out to @theRealRickolas on IG or email saisonzeronyc@gmail.com. The event is free, and open to all with an open mind and imagination! rsvp

title: 7 Deadly Sines
excerpt:
This Pride month, livecode.NYC would like to spotlight the other deadly sins with a night of queer livecode music and visuals. Join us for an evening filled with the 7 deadly sines, from wrathful amplitudes to slothful wavelengths and maybe a tangent or two.

Performances by:

Missy

gwenprime

keyboard cowboy

The Rebel Scum, aka: Codenobi and Wookie

https://instagram.com/livecodenyc

https://twitter.com/livecodenyc

LiveCode.NYC is a New York City-based collective that gathers to discuss, promote, and explore real-time programming. Our members include artists, engineers, actors, designers, educators, musicians, game developers, and writers. We view live coding as a methodology and not specific to a particular medium or language. buy tickets

How a group of \[ravers\] having passed the Line was driven by storms to the cold Country towards \[Wonderville\]; and how from thence she made her course to the tropical Latitude of \[Bushwick\]; and of the strange things that befell; and in what manner the \[ravers\] came back to \[their apartments\].

excerpt: Live, from Twitch dot TV forward slash __________, it's the FORT90 FILM CLUB! And for the month of June 2024, am going to lower my defenses and show movies that are guaranteed to appease the puritans who crash the party on Twitch. And what's more family friendly than motion pictures from the Walt Disney Company? Tho not just any Disney flicks, including a few that are not found on their streaming service... for "reasons". WATCH ON TWITCH

title: Wonderville Karaoke
excerpt: You got the music in you? Come down to Wonderville, on the second Sunday of every month, to share a song with the gentle hum of DIY arcade games as your backup singers. Or simply be entertained by the vocal stylings of randos off the street. Either way, don't forget to tip your bartender! rsvp

title: Grand Slam
excerpt:
Take yourself out to the ballgame and join us for a night of breaking balls and break beats.

Upcoming DJs Kweku and Ephem will be joined by local favorites and Like That Records associates Certified Jesus Freak and FLWRSHRK to keep the hits coming all night long. Come through to play some arcade games and dance for 9 innings of garage, hardgroove, acid house, tech house, Afrohouse, Jersey club, jungle, baile funk, rap, r&b, and more. Watch out for those curveballs!

Donations are welcome to support the DJs, suggestion of $10. rsvp

title: 2 HR GameJam Club
excerpt: Make a game in 2 hours!Each month, we will make short games using simple to use game engines.This is great for beginners who want to make AND FINISH their first game!This is also great for experts who want to flex their skills and meet new people.1:00 PM Doors1:30 PM Workshop2:00 PM Game Jam Starts!4:00 PM Jam Ends, Presentations Start!5:00 PM The arcade opens for regular use.This event will be streamed online, so people across the world can participate.This event is free to attend but donations are welcome and help pay for your instructor! RSVP

title: MEÆT SP★CE: VRC X IRL
excerpt:
June 7th // Doors 7.30PM E // Show Starts 8.00PM // FREEMEÆT SP★CE: VRC X IRL is a bi-directional event, existing in Twitch, VRChat, and Wonderville. Performers and audiences will also be projected into each other's events. MEÆT SP★CE is a celebration and exploration of how friendship, collaboration, technology, and embodiment are enmeshed.

Featuring IRL acts: No Jersey, Jay Ackley, HEXE.EXE, radarwhiskers, and seriouslove.

Featuring VRC acts: Dayrose & TehArbitter, KitsuneMixes, treesleeper.twitch.tv/wondervillenycVRC join off CalibanGreeneWonderville: 1186 Broadway Brooklyn NY 11221NO JERSEYJAY ACKLEYHEXE.EXERADARWHISKERSSERIOUSLOVE DAYROSETEHARBITETERKITSUNEMIXESTREESLEEPER rsvp

title: LVL Grind 2
excerpt:
Extreme music returns to Wonderville once again for an intense Monday night filled with a ripping mixed bill of grindcore, noise, death metal, and whatever the hell Cinemartyr is! The lineup this time around consists of the grindcore bands Artificial Scarcity and Stopping Power (from Philly), Providence harsh noise veteran Interzone Agent, Brooklyn's finest weird-ass experimental death metal band Cendiate, and the aforementioned local electronic industrial math rock (?) legends Cinemartyr.It's going to be a hell of a Monday night, with the only requirement for entry being that you're old enough to enter the bar. We'd love for you to throw some money towards Interzone Agent and Stopping Power having some travel funds though, so a $10 suggested donation would be cool. Doors at 7, music at 8, free indie arcade games all night, and don't forget to tip your bartender well!

Artificial Scarcity: Bandcamp Instagram

Interzone Agent: Bandcamp Instagram

Cendiate: Bandcamp Instagram

Stopping Power: Bandcamp Instagram

Cinemartyr: Bandcamp Instagram rsvp
